Sentencas: The microstructural stability at elevated temperatures and the mechanical properties of 8 mol% yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) has been investigated.
Titulo: Room and high temperature failure mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The YSZ was supplied by two manufacturers as 150 mu m thick sheet suitable for the electrolyte in a planar solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Room and high temperature failure mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The two materials had the cubic structure and this crystal structure was maintained up to 1100 degrees C, which was the highest temperature investigated.
Titulo: Room and high temperature failure mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: However, there were differences, albeit small in most cases, in composition, density, grain size and surface finish between the products from the two manufacturers.
Titulo: Room and high temperature failure mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Although the compositional and structural variations resulted in some differences in mechanical performance, the general trends shown by both materials were similar.
Titulo: Room and high temperature failure mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The strength, as determined by biaxial flexure, fell by 23-30% on increasing the test temperature from room temperature (RT) to the SOFC operating temperature of 950 degrees C and there was evidence for changes in crack initiation and propagation mechanisms at the higher temperature.
Titulo: Room and high temperature failure mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The loading rate dependence of the RT strength yielded a low value for the stress exponent n in the standard lifetime equation, which indicated that sub-critical crack growth (sccg) was sensitive to applied stress.
Titulo: Room and high temperature failure mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Constant load tests at 950-1000 degrees C illustrated the sensitivity of sccg to stress and revealed that creep was also operative in this temperature range.
Titulo: Room and high temperature failure mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: It was concluded that the creep probably occurred by a grain boundary diffusion mechanism.
Titulo: Room and high temperature failure mechanisms in solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes
